properties.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Edwardsport.
* from Sunday afternoon until further notice.
* At  7:00 AM Friday the stage was 9.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Sunday afternoon and continue
to rise to near 21.6 feet by late Tuesday night.
* At 22.9 feet...A 25 foot section of Levee Unit 8 failed at this
level on March 6 2011...flooding local roads behind the  levee.
Flooding not nearly as bad as June 2008 levee failure.  Flooding
was very close to one of the June 2008 failures.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
